name: minmax
description:
This is a sub-function API for tool twelve_data.
Tool description: Financial data provided for developers, to enter the world markets. Instant access for real-time and historical data of stocks, forex, crypto, ETFs, indices, and more. Read more in [documentation](https://twelvedata.com/docs) and start [here](https://twelvedata.com/apikey).
API description: Retrieve the lowest and highest values over a specified period (MINMAX) for a given financial instrument.

interval.description: Interval between two consecutive points in the time series. Supports: '1min', '5min', '15min', '30min', '45min', '1h', '2h', '4h', '1day', '1week', '1month'.

symbol.description: Instrument symbol, which can be any equity, index, ETF, forex, or cryptocurrency (e.g., 'AAPL', 'EUR/USD', 'ETH/BTC').

series_type.description: Type of series data. Supports: 'open', 'high', 'low', 'close'. Default is 'close'.

outputsize.description: Default `30` when no date parameters are set, otherwise set to maximum

format.description: Desired format of the output. Can be 'CSV' or 'JSON'. Default is 'json'.

time_period.description: Time period over which the minmax values are calculated. Default is 9.
